poem:
**Among the Vines**

In Baden, Pfalz, and Mosel valley,
where the German Wine Route unwinds,
Riesling bubbles murmur
like ancient spirits in the vineyards.
Castles stand as patient sentinels.
Hikers and cyclists,
glasses raised to lips,
sip the landscape,
toast the past,
and glide through the green whispers
of a thousand vintages.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "10 of the best regions in Europe for sparkling wine Riesling to the challenge Germans drink more bubbly than any other nationality, with riesling sekt (from the regions of Baden, Pfalz and Mosel) absolutely the top quaff. The best way to seek out sekt is along the 85km-long German Wine Route (the country’s oldest) – an idyllic rural stretch studded with castles and encompassing hiking and cycling routes that wiggle through villages, vineyards and forests". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
